questions.text: Which of these regular characters appears first on-screen during this very first episode?
questions.explanation:
Trapper.

	The very first scene, prior to the theme music, shows Trapper's foot as he sets up for a golf shot. The next shot is of Trapper setting up his shot while Hawkeye and Ho-Jon look on.

questions.text: Who utters the first word of this pilot episode of M*A*S*H?
questions.explanation:
Trapper.

	Again, Trapper wins! Following his golf shot, prior to the theme music and the opening credits, the ball lands in a mine field and explodes a mine. Trapper shouts...'Fore!'

questions.text: Which of these actors from the film did not make an appearance in the pilot?
questions.explanation:
John Schuck.

	John Schuck, who plays the 'Painless Pole' in the film, does not appear in the pilot episode. However, Gary Burghoff (Radar), Timothy Brown (Spearchucker, but Corporal Judson in the film) and George Wood (General Hammond) all appear in both the film and the first episode of the series.

questions.text: Which of these characters from the film has his name mentioned in the pilot episode, but does not actually make an appearance?
questions.explanation:
Painless Pole.

	Hawkeye mentions Painless when he's counting the raffle tickets for Ho-Jon's party. Larry Gelbart decided to do away with the Duke Forrest character from the film...and the other characters, Vollmer and Boone, were also seen as superfluous. Incidentally, Lorenzo Boone was played by Bud Cort in the film, while Tom Skerritt played Duke Forrest.

questions.text: How much money did Hawkeye and Trapper need to raise in order to pay the first installment of Ho-Jon's tuition?
questions.explanation:
1,000 dollars.

	1,000 dollars is needed for tuition, but the doctors calculate that they'll need to raise 2,000 dollars overall to pay for other expenses for Ho-Jon's trip and living.

questions.text: The winner of the raffle will receive a trip for two to Tokyo with which nurse?
questions.explanation:
Lt. Dish

	Yes...revealing the somewhat sexist nature of the early episodes, Lt. Dish is 'raffled' off for Ho-Jon's sake. Fortunately, Hawkeye fixes it so that Father Mulcahy wins the raffle.

questions.text: Which general does Margaret summon in order to reveal the debauchery of the M*A*S*H inhabitants?
questions.explanation:
General Hammond.

	General Hammond...mentioned previously in this quiz!

questions.text: True or false: William Christopher makes an appearance in the pilot episode.
questions.explanation:
False & F.

	William Christopher, aka Father Mulcahy, does not appear in the pilot. Instead, George Morgan plays Mulcahy in the pilot. I guess they didn't like this actor...he only lasted one episode!

questions.text: True or false: Klinger appears in the pilot episode.
questions.explanation:
False & F.

	The beloved Klinger character, played by Jamie Farr, doesn't show up until the 4th episode of the first season.

questions.text: Who wins the raffle, and a trip for two with a nurse to Tokyo?
questions.explanation:
Father Mulcahy.

	As I mentioned before...it was a fix!
